glsa.title: VIPS: Privilege Escalation
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in VIPS could result in privilege escalation.

background.p: VIPS is a free image processing system.

description.p: VIPS places a zero-length directory name in the LD_LIBRARY_PATH, which might result in the current working directory (.) to be included when searching for dynamically linked libraries.

impact.p: A local attacker could gain escalated privileges via a specially crafted shared library.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All VIPS users should upgrade to the latest version:
NOTE: This is a legacy GLSA. Updates for all affected architectures are available since November 23, 2010. It is likely that your system is already no longer affected by this issue.
